2.text: “Bear with me a little longer, and I will show you that there is more to be said on God’s behalf.

3.text: I get my knowledge from afar, and I will ascribe justice to my Maker.

4.text: For truly my words are free of falsehood; one perfect in knowledge is with you.

5.text: Indeed, God is mighty, but He despises no one; He is mighty in strength of understanding.

6.text: He does not keep the wicked alive, but He grants justice to the afflicted.

7.text: He does not take His eyes off the righteous, but He enthrones them with kings and exalts them forever.

8.text: And if men are bound with chains, caught in cords of affliction,

9.text: then He tells them their deeds and how arrogantly they have transgressed.

10.text: He opens their ears to correction and commands that they turn from iniquity.

11.text: If they obey and serve Him, then they end their days in prosperity and their years in happiness.

12.text: But if they do not obey, then they perish by the sword and die without knowledge.

13.text: The godless in heart harbor resentment; even when He binds them, they do not cry for help.

14.text: They die in their youth, among the male shrine prostitutes.

15.text: God rescues the afflicted by their affliction and opens their ears in oppression.

16.text: Indeed, He drew you from the jaws of distress to a spacious and broad place, to a table full of richness.

17.text: But now you are laden with the judgment due the wicked; judgment and justice have seized you.

18.text: Be careful that no one lures you with riches; do not let a large bribe lead you astray.

19.text: Can your wealth or all your mighty effort keep you from distress?

20.text: Do not long for the night, when people vanish from their homes.

21.text: Be careful not to turn to iniquity, for this you have preferred to affliction.

22.text: Behold, God is exalted in His power. Who is a teacher like Him?

23.text: Who has appointed His way for Him, or told Him, ‘You have done wrong’?

24.text: Remember to magnify His work, which men have praised in song.

25.text: All mankind has seen it; men behold it from afar.

26.text: Indeed, God is great—beyond our knowledge; the number of His years is unsearchable.

27.text: For He draws up drops of water which distill the rain from the mist,

28.text: which the clouds pour out and shower abundantly on mankind.

29.text: Furthermore, who can understand how the clouds spread out, how the thunder roars from His pavilion?

30.text: See how He scatters His lightning around Him and covers the depths of the sea.

31.text: For by these He judges the nations and provides food in abundance.

32.text: He fills His hands with lightning and commands it to strike its mark.

33.text: The thunder declares His presence; even the cattle regard the rising storm.
